title: InventHelp Device Keeps Horses From Running Scared In the Event of a Rider Fall (ORD-2156)
text:
Pittsburgh-based InventHelp, founded in 1984, is submitting the GT AUTO STOP to companies for their review.
PITTSBURGH, PA (PRWEB) October 16, 2015
"I used to work with horses, and one of the most worrisome possibilities was a horse running free and scared after a rider fell off of it," said one of two inventors from Guernsey, Channel Islands. "In order to prevent this dangerous problem, the co-inventor and I designed a failsafe for such a situation."
Ideal for jockeys, horse trainers and horse clubs, the GT AUTO STOP solves the problem of a horse running free and scared after its rider falls off. It ensures that the horse will stop immediately, which avoids injuries to both the horse and humans. Overall, it promotes safety and peace of mind.
The original design was submitted to the Orlando office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 14-ORD-2156, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
